intro: Solenostemon monostachyus subsp. lateriticola, commonly known as the lateritic solenostemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or lateritic habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
